column11: Review Text

column8: Uhh I mean it's a nice activity
column11: Wow well it was ok .I mean nothing worked but there was 3 or 4 slides that did work and the slides that did work were EPIC AND AMAZING!!!!!!! But don't get your hopes up it was worth going though  definitely worth going Children that are  small like an elf don't bother coming but if your in your teens it's definitely worth coming . I mean there was no queues. No waiting Nice people so yes it's definitely a nice trip to do for a few hours . By cosy mable lewis aged 10

column8: Experience In a water park, with constructive criticism.
column11: I visited there with few friends, overall good experience, water slides were good, especially the sling shot There were some problems too. Some good water slides were not functioning due to lack of staff, ( not broken, since I have used it same day morning ) Most of the water slides are broken Most of relaxing chairs are broken, the first chair I get on was broken, I have explained that to the staff but they refused to belive that saying that machine says its working, that chair left me a backache since its broken, archad ares staff need more training, they should know in and out of every machine there but they don't, i think they have never played any of those games or have experienced what they sell, I suggest a staff workshop they can too enjoy and learn about there product which will improve the service quality. HR manager can improve the service I guess. But staff was frendy, not badmouthing, they just need proper technical training. Food are wayyyyy overpriced, but its the normal for parks here. Don't just buy dry area tickets since there not much to do, arcade is not that good. Don't buy full premium packaged, most of the slides and machines are not working, Just buy normal water package and buy anything not included separately. When you use slingshot slide ( which need 2 people ) be carefully of the person you go with, if that person is not decipinarry enough, you can get hurt. ( but it's the best slide ) and when you comes down keep your legs inside rubber tube, that is not instructed but don't trust the person you go with anyway. Overall good experience, hope it gets better in future.

column8: Take a close look on Maintenance üòë
column11: This is my second visit to there.My first visit was okay with the maintaining but this time is poor.Appreciate if you can concern on maintain play areas since this is one of biggest leisure spots in Sri Lanka.
Have being here many times with kids, one of the best places to get experience on thrilling rides from Sri Lankan context

Waterworld is a place I have come three times. This is the first time I'm coming to the Water Park. So this is for those 1st timers. * The water section opens at 11am and closes at 4.30pm and NOT 9am to 5pm. * Certain rides such as Wave Pool were only at 3pm. Call and ask so you can plan ahead. * Call ahead to find out if a ride not operational to avoid frowns from the kids. * Food and drinks are not allowed from outside. Have to be purchased from the food court inside. It's a decent place with even a ladies only pool. The lack of website and social media updates on this sort of information prevents me from a better review.

Leisure World is a wonderful, extensive theme park, and one of its kind in Sri Lanka. Blessed with magnificent biodiversity, the park collates the experiences of an amusement park, water park, and a national park

Reasonable price. Very Helpful staff. More things to enjoy. Maverick was not working during our visit. Maverick was the most adventurous equipment according to my knowledge . So management need to take measures make available the such adevnturous Equipment at all time since visitors would not visit the place very often. So vistors will miss a event.
Not recommended very rude staff and doesn‚Äôt care about customer inquiries. Awful service and  overcharged for worthless service.

column8: Not worth the money they charge
column11: This is just an averge place for watr rides and nothing great or special about it. Considering the qulity of rides and facilities, I found it over priced and not worth the money they charge.

We went to leisure world as a day outing on a Sunday in December 2018. It is a huge place with lots of activities for all. The place was over crowded and staff were rude and disrespectful, I think may be trying to control the crowd. It is important to carry the entrance ticket with you, as it is needed to enter the entertainment areas, unfortunately which no one told us at the entrance. Lots of activities for everyone, but strange rules in some areas, where they have limit to children under 10,  where my 11 year old were not allowed to play. Unfortunately he couldn't participate in other water play, as they were too adventurous for him. Staff were not flexible. All in all good place but bad attitudes, probably better when not over crowded.
The place is good for fun loving families with kids. The staff however, are very rude and not good in communicating with customers. Also, they don't allow any swimwear unless it is made of nylon.

It should allow us to wear cloths other than nylon .. nylon will be very tight and we don‚Äôt wear that type of cloths so all our money got wasted . This was the first time so we didn‚Äôt knew. Not coming again. We only wanted to enjoy the water activities..
we went as a family.Its more safety and like in a foreign country. we enjoyed lot.As locals would be like to have low price.
Go early to enjoy all access. take care at water slides and little hardness at water slides. But full of fun and enjoy

Only place in Sri Lanka in this nature. Proud as a Sri Lankan that we have a water / dry amusement park.However compaired to what we have experienced in other Asian countries, this place is far below the standards in all terms. Speacially the staff not trained for customer service. Their hospitality, guidance and caring customers is NEGATIVE. Especially the ladies. They dont know what they are paid for. Very arrogant and not helpful at all. Time allocated for each ride is very little compared to what we have experinced in Malaysia, Singapore. In some machines , safety belts are not working. Some activities / machines will be available for a short interval and if you are unable to be there on that time slot you have to foget about your money spent on ticket. Food court is good and prices are reasonable.

i been in this place with my family & good time but all toilets changing rooms entrances saftey pool guards all that need real development & changing. people need lots of services & resturants not less than 5 stars level

Leisure world is biggest first fun park in Sri Lanka. Located in Avissawella. There are two areas one water park and one dry games area. Water park equipped with many adventures and you can have maximum fun. Must visit place in Sri Lanka specially for kids and teenagers. Reasonable entry fee. Ideal place for family day outing.

we went there last weekend and it was a very nice experience. not heavy crowded and there are lot of games to do. sri Lankans must visit this place there and you can get your photographs as well. There is an artificial beach and unfortunately, we were unable to go there because it opens for half an hour only.

Ive been there last week and i was told that they have snapped myself and i can collect it from their photoshop at the exit. When i go there i asked them to print it and send it to my e mail as well, then i was told that there‚Äôs an additional charge for it and i paid including that and dropped my email address. But even as at today i still didn‚Äôt receive their mail. Pls do not trust them and let them send the mail while u wait if u want them to mail. Park experience was good and safe.

Was a family outing and accompanied with another family. All of us were 07 including kids. Intentions was to have very good time for our kids. Although our expectations were very high, outcome was neutral. Some of machines at outdoor was not working. Staff was supportive but they are not at their best. However water park experience was good though some were not working/operative at that day. Value for money could be a question ???
It‚Äôs a good amusement park, there are many games to do. They need to develop more. It‚Äôs a place locals must visit.

It's such a shame that this place is not well maintained as it could be great. Like many things in Sri Lanka it appears that no maintenance or renovation has been done since it opened. There were some guys painting one of the bridges but it appears to be too little too late. Broken steps, weeds coming through the pavement.  Squalid , smelly changing rooms with broken toilet doors. There is actually a sign in the toilet area requesting people "do not vomit in sinks"!!! Possibly because people have in the past due to the smell??? In the kids pool there is a tyre to swing on that is rusted and has sharp edges. The lazy river does not work so is just still. The wave pool only produces waves for half an hour a day. Many people seemed to be enjoying the place possibly because it's all sri lanka has and they have no idea about the shockingly low standards compared to waterparks in other countries. Seriously management..sort it out! It could be fantastic if it was renovated and well maintained. If I could give zero stars I would but then my 9 year old actually enjoyed it (kids don't notice rust and other signs of delapidation).
Need some improvement in pool area it‚Äôs not good place to family with ladies (pool area)entrance staff are very rude

Sri Lanka does not have many amusement parks. Leisure world started its operations back in 2016 as the first amusement park of Sri Lanka as a scale down version similar to Sunway lagoon Malaysia. Don‚Äôt expect this to be as same as other theme parks around the world . It‚Äôs a fairly average amusement park . It has water activities as well as dry activities . They have a separate section for kids and ladies too . For a country like Sri Lanka this is quite alright . However they can take a leaf out of how theme parks are operated around the world . Staff needs to improve in checking and advising customers on safety precautions. They do not look that active and seems like they need some training . The equipment looks like they have not being serviced in a long time so it will not be surprising if you get bit scared but the equipments worked alright . It has a restaurant area , gaming area, relaxing massage area as well . The park opens for customer at 9.00 am and closes at 4.30. There are no options to book tickets online so you need to buy them onsite . The crowd is heavy during April and December . Prices are fairly ok .

Today Sunday (8th) my family and my Managing Director‚Äôs family (with Kids) visited. Until 9.32 am there was only ONE counter was open and there was a queue around 1/4 kilometer. I called to the numbers of the website , one number was not working & another number was connected to the security. Another number was not answered. I asked the reason of not opening the other 2 counters. Finally I talked to the manager and he was trying to explain the process of computers. Finally I told him Very clearly who I am. Generally the staff were not friendly. Preventive maintenance has not been done for YEARS. It‚Äôs very dangerous to participate for certain events. I found the staff were having lunch in a TENT . I felt sad that the management has not treated them with minimum facilities. So obviously the staff have no job satisfaction. So the Customers can‚Äôt expect an enthusiastic service. The wash rooms  & toilets were very dirty & bad smell. Can‚Äôt understand why you can‚Äôt properly maintain.  Finally the restaurant food was very much ok. The service of restaurant staff met my expectations. Guys please do extra care of your valuable customers & staff. Kindly try to understand I have been all over the world. It‚Äôs up to you to understand & take necessary actions.

We went their with my family and we had to wait more than 2 hours for a tube. They should have a mechanism of having tubes to be exchanged when one is done with one round. But for the price they charge they should have enough tubes. Also we could see lack of maintenance all covered with rust. All dry activities lacks safety seat belts are broken in some equipment.    But 8 years back it was a good place to enjoy.

We had visited the theme park Last July 2017 with friends. The entrance and the welcoming area has a beautiful panoramic view of the lake and some cool activities. Pros: 1. Many water activities with a wave pool. 2. Beautiful panoramic view of the entrance 3. Can try Water slides Cons: 1. Zero Safety 2. Very old equipment with low-maintenance 3. The worst Toilet system 4. Changing room? i have no words to express. They need a very fast action to renovate. 5. Not well trained Life guards (They are just neighbourhood teenagers) 6. Cleanliness 0. 7. Over crowded on weekends. 8. Not worth for money. 9. Old age rusty equipment Not recommended!

I have visited this theme park since it opened.in the beginning it was very nice but after few years, the way they maintain this place is very bad.safety is very poor.no seat belts RUST everywhere.in water area they should increase the amount of tubes available specially on weekends.we had to waste soo much of time looking for tubes. life guards are not managing ques properly.my brother had to wait 20 mins because one family holding the line for soo long and life guard is just standing and letting people do what ever they do.i think this place can be much more fun and safe.need to improve alot.

This place has great beginnings but somehow the quality of the place is on the decline. Especially on the safety mechanisms. The washrooms are like hell....wonder what the cleaning staff are doing . The staff have little or no regard for the safety of the riders.Please watch out for loads of "out of order " equipments at rides.Would not recommend for small kids and elderly.

From the entrance it was very informative, what rides to be taken whats not availabale. When you enter inside the park you get to hear these sri lankan love songs, kind of made me feel weird. Even though the rides are fun and thrilling enjoyed the tube ride so much.a must try too.

We had some great time.. Really a great place to getaway for enjoyment. But the equipments need maintenance, like painting and removal of rust, though its a hard work you are charging us enough for the tickets, also the staff should be little more polite, some they are really good, some they are really bad.. Identify them and train them.

Visited with wife and 3 & half son. Got tickets for water park only. Since he's too young for other stuff. They charge tickets based on kids height. So it was 1500 for the kid. Yet there were some rides he was not allowed to do. As we had to accompany him we couldn't enjoy much either. So think twice if you wanna visit with young kids. Also always seek safety instructions prior to ride anything. I had one ride with no instructions and got my feet hurt. Don't rely on food inside food court to Serve you great food. Out of all we enjoyed 9D cinema as they call it.

You need a day, to enjoy all activities, Water games are awesome.difficult to access from colombo it takes nearly 2 hours to reach the destination from Bambalapitiya Colombo. Wear swimsuit is necessary for  water games . swimsuit shops, canteens and photoshop are available inside. swimsuits sells on are very reasonable rate. food and lunch are sells on usual price.

- Its 2 hour drive outside Colombo. Got tired reaching this place - The lake and water body was not clean - The person/staff at the entrance was helpful and guided us well and was very courteous. Could speak in English - major credit cards accepted - since it was weekday, the area was empty - the staff at the rides weren't accessible .. couldn't understand or guide us properly - sadly the wave pool was there only for 3pm to 3:30pm - there is a discount of 50% till 30th March, price wise it's decent - the food court was average and it took an hour to serve the food.. however the lady manager at the Amranik food court was very courteous.. - We tried the water parks and my kids loved it.. - please train the team to approach and help the visitors (not necessarily only tourists, but also the locals) instead of ganging up to chit chat.. - there are lot of opportunities for you to make it great

I whould say we had very exiting time, we really enjoyed our visit pretty well, one thig  we didnt like was when check in we were not informed that there is locker facility available if some one have explained to us whould have been nice. The staff at the kids pool are not very polite, if you be able to explained more about what the customer service to the staff people will more like it.

We took the package B what's included with all the water activities. I had my proper swimming suite but there were 3 ladies at the kids pool and they were saying to remove some parts of my swim ware, first at all please give them a proper knowledge about different king of swim ware, and also they didn't knew how to talk to their customers properly. To be honest there were very friendly staff as well. Most of the rides are about to fall down so I prefer if they could do a proper renovation. Thank you
I have gone there with my girl and some friends of mine.we had a great fun. Actually There are so many activities to do.sooo I love this place ‚ô•Ô∏è

We took 24 children to whom we had promised a treat.  We had been 6 years before when in Sri Lanka and thought it was badly maintained and dangerous then.  It is even worse now - nothing seems to have been repaired.  There are workmen everywhere and their tools are just left hanging around.  I don't see why children in Sri Lanka should be exposed to more danger on rides or in terms of safety than our children at home.

It needs a major renovation. Some rides are not functioning. I can see many places where accidents could take place. Safety measures they have taken are very minimal. Staff operate the rides do not advise on how to act when they go on the ride. Perhaps they cannot tell this to thousand odd people who'd come. Therefore they can always print and give at the entrance or display near each ride. Also in the water park for some rides you do not have to wear nylon swim wear but for some rides it's required. That's totally understandable but some stupid people do not get it. Therefore it's better to make it compulsory in the water park and clearly mention this so staff will not have to get abused by some morons who do not understand this.another thing is the equipments you need for the water rides is not enough and not proper mechanism to distribute . Therefore people gather around in the end of the ride to grab these. They won't wait till the person finishes the ride and they just stay at the end. It's so lot safe and annoying as hell. Park should have a way to get these to the top so people do not have to fight for it. This way everybody gets the chance. Please do not go until they renovate and obtain a well recognized by international standards.

This was the second time we went to the park, the first being when our daughter was 2 and hence we spent most of our time in the baby pool area and didn't see much of the other rides. This time though, we tried almost all the rides and while the rides itself were much fun for a 6 year old, and us, we found the rides to be poorly maintained.  We heard a crashing sound at one ride and turned around to see a rusted piece fall off! In addition, most of the stairs leading up to the rides as well as the surrounding areas and specially the toilets and changing rooms were very dirty and terribly maintained. My husband, at the end of one ride, stepped on something hard in the pool and fished out a chicken bone! Gross! Also beware that if you are a foreigner the management tries to bully you into buying swimwear from their shop! When we first went in we were told that proper swimwear would be required, which was not a problem for us as we all had good swim wear bought at speciality swim shops in Colombo. We didn't have any problems at any of the rides or the baby pool area. The staff at the baby pool area even felt my swimsuit, which was a two piece with a short sleeved rash guard and accompanying tights and checked it off as proper swimwear. At the wave pool thought, at the end of the day, at 3.00 pm, staff at the entrance refused to let me into the pool claiming that I was not wearing proper swimwear. One even went on to say that the material was that of proper swimwear but since it 'looked' like a t-shirt (which all rashguards obviously do to some extent!!) I would not be allowed in! This came as a shock as for the whole day I had had no problems, and had in fact seen Sri Lankans in attire ranging from tops made from crepe-like material going on the rides, to long flowing black gown like dresses! I went to the front desk to complain and was told that what I was wearing was not a swimsuit as all swim wear obviously have cupping at the front! Which I assume means built in bras? The manager then proceeded to show me to the swim wear shop on the premises and told me that what was available there was what they considered swim wear! When I insisted that I was in fact wearing a Arena brand swimwear bought from an extremely reputable Swim shop in Colombo, the manager told me that if I wanted to argue with him he could very well argue with me also, and quite rudely told me that I needed to educate myself on what real swim wear was! When I mentioned that his staff at rides other rides had not had a problem he told me to go and raise the issue with them. Which makes me wonder what the whole point of having a manager was! We met quite a few other foreigners who had the same problem as we did, with the staff at the wave pool insisting their rash guards were not proper attire for swimming, while there were local Sri Lankan men in track bottoms and what not in the same pool we were being barred from üò° Staff at the dry park were also not very well trained with ticket sales staff selling tickets for my three year old (our 2nd daughter) for rides but staff at the ride entrances telling us that she would not be allowed on the rides. Which led to a whole lot of tears from my daughter, and us having to trudge back to the counter to get refunds for tickets. All in all, it was a very disappointing end to a fun day. The place needs a lot of maintenance and upkeep effort, as well as a change in management and staff attitudes for the place to go from mediocre to good. The potential is there though!

First thing the que to buy the ticket was so difficult. The locals are so great on cutting line. No discipline at all. All the rides comes with a big long que. Which is ok as I have been to other theme parks, the problem here is the locals have no patience and they are expert to cut the que line. The toilet is so dirty I couldn't even breath in there. No toilet paper and wash room is very dirty. The log ride was interesting but the water over the area was so dirty and the boats are so dirty. They should clean the area and the boats. And each area the ticket counter is just near the line of waiting So after they buy the ticket they just push them inside the que line I don't like the place at all.

Many attractions and packages are available but the management runs certain sections on;y if there is a crowd. We went on a holiday and the queues were long and then you could not finish your package! It is open only for a limited time as well which is a bit of a rip off. Not sure about the hygienic conditions though with so many using tje same water.

Visited as family few days back. Amazing place in Sri Lanka for water fun and machine rides. At present it is the only theme park upto the standards, in Sri Lanka. Enjoyed very well. We had a very warm welcome right from the car park, and the receptionist and people in the ticket counter were very friendly. We enjoyed well, especially the kids. The 3D cinema experience was unbeatable! There were few things that the Management should take care of to improve the customer satisfaction. 1. Seats in some machines were untidy, rusty, broken and the belts were not intact, tied together or so. Better to give clear instructions to people before operating the machines. Lack of maintenance and carelessness may result in disaster one day! 2. We went in the afternoon and disappointed in some stations where the operators didn't come forward to help. They looked tired and were non-responsive. We thought of going back home. A female operator finally helped us. Thanks for her. The attitude of others made us extremely uncomfortable. They were chatting together and when we approached them to operate the machines , a male operator told to another one as "I can't help them" which was clearly audible to us. This kind of behaviour will hurt the visitors. Sorry to say this. Leaving the bitter moments apart, this place is ideal for Kids and Families to enjoy. Strongly suggest it. Better to go early, by 0900 Hrs in the morning, so that you can enjoy well. You will need atleast 3 hours to have the maximum fun. The wave pool opens at 1500 Hrs and closes at 1530 Hrs. Water area is closed at 1630 Hrs and the park is closed at 1700 Hrs. Must visit kind of place!
Excellent theme park for kids and family. A must see for tourists of Sri Lanka. The wave pool, the water park along with other challenging  rides  are fully worth for the money spent on this park

Me and my family members saw human poop in one of the pool. I informed one of the staff n they were not very serious about it. Later one person attended the scene with a net like thing n put all the all those stuff in the drains where all the water goes.. he was very careless. After few minutes they opened the place n lots kids started using the pool. The best part is I never saw them putting any chlorine or anything in there to clean it.. This is really very bad..
A nice place for young crowd as well as for the kids. We enjoyed a lot. Water games are the best.Log flume is our favorite. Can have a nice photograph at the end.

Leisureworld was a good balance theme park with good entertainment for the whole family. Though this is below the standards of the theme parks of the other Asian countries (ex: Thailand) this the best in the island. The water park is at high standards while the others part of the park is fairly OK. Good for small children to spend a good day out with the huge land area of the facility. The area is not the cleanest. The 4D cinema was not the best though with malfunctioning at the time we visited. If I summarize this is the best theme park (from what I have visited) in Sri Lanka and it has all with few additions. But there are lot to improve the standards of each.
most of the rides are quite old, but i enjoyed most of the water rides. hoping that new attractions and rides are to be introduced
Went with my family and enjoyed very much most activities are thrill,some are under construction but it wil be ready i like it very much
Great place to enjoy for couples, youngsters & Young Families. Good rest area with AC main Restaurant.

I visited this place on the 31st of July 2016 with my family whilst on holiday in SL. Staff at the ticket counter (especially the lady in the saree -sorry can't remember your name)you were good. Good customer service given to my parents who were elderly and only visited the place to  spend time with their grand children. You changed their ticket  from package A as they weren't using any facilities on the premises and were merely observers which  enabled them to be part of the kids day!!! Thanks so much!!! I was disappointed  to find the entrance ticket didn't allow any  parent who are not elderly  to enter the wet area  unless they purchased at least package A which I find a steep price  of thousand rupees. Although we didn't mind I really felt for the parents who couldn't afford for the whole family to attend the wet rides. I feel as observers they should be allowed to accompany their kids around the whole park  as there are sufficient staff at each ride site to check the bands which indicate who is allowed to use the rides so I don't see why the restriction for wet rides section? Wet area is covered with a ridiculous fence and gate which restricts parents overseeing their kids safety not to mention to share their happiness unless they also purchase package A. One parent actually asked us to call their child as they couldn't see them. I really felt for them as they were glued against the fence trying to get a glimpse of their child and  couldn't afford to pay an additional price to get into that area. The large lockers didn't have padlocks so if you take a backpack or a large bag you can't store anything securely. There were tiny lockers only to keep a very small bag. Toilets were gross not cleaned at all, I found better toilets in rural areas in SL! There is also steep steps up and down  the park , not suitable for people with disabilities. I saw a wheelchair user accessing the wet area through the gate but waited a long time for someone to let them in and out. The whole park is on various levels accessed via steps. Very steep landscape making difficult to move a WC. Please note the facilities doesn't allow a disabled person to take part in any activity. I didn't see any hoists of any sort or ramps to access rides. They can only be observers. I found the rides to be old equipment and to be honest there are better rides at your local fun fair. Seen as this is the only adventure park in SL my two nieces living in SL had a good time. My son loved the water park which he always looks forward to on holidays and are located on site of the hotels we choose. SL really need hotels with water rides to attract more families as this location is a bit of a journey from Colombo. All in all if you are living abroad you have better places than this however if you are at a loose end with kids on holiday maybe worth the journey. I feel it's not worth the hassle to travel that far. Note to Customer Service - please review your package deals for families with young children. Please allow parents to access all areas as observers with a Entrance Ticket so that they can accompany their kids. You have ample staffing to check arm bands on children before they gets on the rides which would enable parents to be closer to their kids.

I went there with my family members (age 20-30) and we focused on water park. Most of the activities are quite fun and suitable for young generation. Nice place to hangout  with friends. Normally water park opens at 11 am; but i think its better if they can open it much earlier. By the time we get there some of the activities were shutdown and we were really disappoint about that. And they are opening main pool  around 3 pm which is not compatible time period for most of the visitors. Food and swimming suites are available at the place. Car park is clean and space enough.

After many years of yearning to go to leisure world. I went there with 7 of my friends We reached the park by 9.00 am. First thing I noticed was, front of the entrance there was a fountain and sadly there was no water coming out of it. I hoped rest of the park is not a resemblance of it.. We bought a "Supreme Package" ticket which costs Rs. 1850 per head. As the name suggests it consisted of all the activities and entrance to water park too It was right after Eid, so eventhough it was a weekday it was fairly crowded We went to almost all the amusement rides expect for Water boat (like in Nuwara Eliya) But only the "Maverick - 12" was really amusing!!! Ofcoz others were okay Then we headed to the Water activities in our shorts.. As expected it was really fun except for the rude comments passed by Lankan Youths.. Lolz You can have a taste of it at the pool area We didn't get to try some slides coz it was crowded but at 4. 00 pm when the "Wave pool " was opened the crowd dispersed there so we stayed back and tried the slides to our content.. Overall it was fun but safety of us is a question. Slides were not maintained or serviced And I really dunno why they there is more girls working, I mean there should be guys to control the crowd especially at the water area Itz a place you definitely should visit!!

I visited three times this place .The swimming dresses are too costly,No proper food and beverages provided ,Also the provided foods are very expensive .The Bath showers are dirty.The car park is too far so in rainy day we have to travel so far ,Better provide another path way than going aound.
Place is good for enjoy but crowded during weekends. Tickets are very expensive and not worth compare with facilities.

Leisure World is a lovely property which is not managed and maintained well. Was there with a few friends this weekend, most of the rides were hacked and not a great experience. I don't think the management worry about the health and safety of the customers at all. Its amazingly dead even during weekends, not a good experience at all, the one and half hour travelling from Colombo to Hanwella was a waste of time.

Leisure World Water park is situated in Hanwella, which is just 30 kilometres away from Colombo. There were many water slides and going in them was a thrilling experience. The water slides have been set up from different heights and the tallest was the most thrilling. I visited there on a Saturday, there weren't much people and almost no queues. I am looking forward to visit there again. Make sure to take a Nylon swimwear because you can't go on many slides without them.

A couple of days ago we went there with our four-year-old daughter with lots of hopes to experience a wonderful time. Honestly speaking it wasn‚Äôt a wonderful, at least a pleasant experience at all. The place is hacked! The machines haven‚Äôt been maintained properly for a very long time.  They were horribly noisy, the safety belts were broken and never been fixed.  The changing rooms plus the washrooms were terrible! Smelly, filthy and didn‚Äôt have proper lighting and ventilation. Going inside these washrooms was definitely a thrill ride for us.  Just the sight of the toilets, which were hardly been washed, can make you throw up. Disgusting! The water area was the only amusement in this park. It was vast with different activities and our kid finally started to have a good time. But here we go again! Even if there were strict regulations on the pool attire, neither visitors nor the staff seemed to have concerns on the rules. Some ladies were in the pool wearing shalwars, denims even saris and jewelry! There were definitely doubts on hygiene of these pools. Even though we wanted to escape the place as soon as possible, we decided to try more dry rides since we paid nearly Rs. 2000 per person. But it was hilarious to find out many rides were closed probably for lunch or something. Who knows! Anyhow, the staff was lethargic, cold and unhelpful. So we gave up and left the place. This place could have been an amazing amusement park with a better management, regular maintenance, and a friendlier staff.  But with the lack of all these things and especially the cleanliness, this is just a total rip off.  It‚Äôs sad that we don‚Äôt have any other amusement parks and the only one we have is a disaster! I will not even consider going back there again.
Nice place good fun it is what a fun good starff.i would like to come back againg and againg.it nice water park in srilanka.

We went there exactly at 4. 10pm in d evening but the staff did not allowed us to go in.  They said that the place is closed at sharp 4.15 then we pointed out the time.  But they did not care they even did not  try to help us in anyway.  We came from faraway before we come we called them. They said place is closed at sharp 5. 00 but they didn't inform us that the counters are closed before 5 .  terrible service we ever experienced.  Staff must know how to treat guests.even though we came 5mnts before the closing time they need to issue tickets.  That is their responsibility.  They closed the counters before 4. 15 but they try to convinced us they are closing at sharp 4. 15  what is the logic of that. Is it the right company rule of the Leisure World.?? Really  Disappointed service.

I visited leisure world for the first time with my family this Sunday. 2 ladies at the entrance explained the rides mentioned in the tickets and that took almost 10 minutes and then the tickets were issued. Information about the rides and how to get to them needs to be more clear and precise as I hardly understood what she spoke for almost 10 minutes. The staff gave a negative impression of their roles and showed dislike towards their job at Leisure World. Not a single employee took an effort to make the visitors comfortable and  to give a pleasant experience of their day spent at the park. The water park changing rooms, both male and female were very very filthy. People just rinse their clothes on the floor. It was more or less like a mud water park. Most of the lockers were unlockers!!!! The bathrooms were in an extremely bad shape. The water park was good and I loved the rides. The downside was that the rides were not maintained properly. Everything was rusty and felt like they will collapse any minute. The rest of the park is not that great. All the other rides on dry land are not maintained properly and there is a big question mark regarding health and safety. No attention was given towards safety and people just enjoy like cats and dogs least bothered about their safety as well as others. The management should think of new and innovative methods to attract more people and make good use of the huge land area of the location. After all any visitor would be willing to even pay more and get a better experience. People should be made aware of safety and also there has to be some plan to maintain the park and to keep all areas clean. If I am to visit again I would definitely use the water area only.

We went on a recent trip to Sri Lanka, on arrival it looks very lovely but the rides are in serious need of some tlc! We paid for the top package which I thought included all the rides only to find that some of the rides you had to pay additional money for which was strange!!! They are not big rides but they are very scary because they sound like they are literally going to fall apart at any minute. Most of the ride operatives look miserable as sin and look like they truly hate their jobs! Also they have very strange opening times for the rides for instance they advise you go on the rides before the water park area, so we went around the rides and come to the log flume next to be told it was shut and would be opening at 4pm??? So we went and got changed in the comunAl changing area and went to investigate the water park!!! Well half the slides were shut and the ones that were open also need some tlc, the towers on which they sit are metal and are rusty as hell so we were scared the towers would collapse on us, the one was visibally moving which was petrifying! So we finished in the water park and went for food which was OK as you would expect, we then went back to the log flume at the children's request only to get soaked after getting dry, so really they should keep the flume open for longer so you don't have to get wet twice! The major downside to this place were the toilet facilities, they were discusting, they do not cater for western people as there was not one scrap of toilet paper at all, the toilets were filthy and soaked and there were even dirty sanitry towels on the floor, the toilet doors were rotten and to be quite honest I would of felt better finding a bush to toilet in, if your English visiting leisure world I'd take some toilet tissue, and some toilet wipes to clean the toilets down with before using! All in all it was an ok day but due to the amount of rides that were shut we were done and dusted in a few hours and fairly bored of going on the same rides over and over! I wouldn't visit again and I wouldn't travel far for the day here!!
Before Six years we had a great fun at this place. But now (Decmber 2016) Maintenance & Customer Relationship is very poor.

After a lot of planning we finally went to this great place with the kids.. the journey from colombo to reach there took about two hours.. and u have to hire a van which cost almost a mare 4500 rps return trip back to colombo.. we left really early in the morning and reached there just in time as the place opened... we all took the package B that cost 1200 rps per person.. the kids as also charged if they are taller then their expected height.. they have great water rides as well as things to do in the dry land.. the food is not so good and as the stalls did not have cool drinks as less people were there so the fridges were switched off.. hehe one whole day until 5 in the evening is not enough to try out all the ridea and  check out the whole place.. wud for sure go there again..

We went to this leisure park for a great day out With a great family , it was an amazing day out , lots to do , the park is a great place , plenty of water slide , some very good some very scary , the day was a great day , loved every minute , plenty for the children to do , thank you slimlinelinetours for a great time ,

This is a nice place. There are several fun activities including water activities. Really joy full for kids. Price for water area for children is bit high. It is same as adult. I think it is not fair to charge the same amount as adults as kids can not do all the activities. I think in Sri Lanka this is the only place we can have some of these experiences. But the problem is maintenance is some what poor. Some are not functioning. Some are functioning but need to think twice before get in to them as appearance is too disappointing.(Seems old and rusticated.) And the staff is not that helpful especially in water area.

Poorly managed. they are lucky to be the only water park in the area. otherwise would have run out of business long time ago. park supposed to open at 9 but actually that's the time they open the gates to the tickets counter. that being said, no information whatsoever to direct the crowd in to queues. package details not visible anywhere near counters so 2 poor female customer care agents were desperately trying to explain all details when you reach the ticket counter. not working. this caused 5-10 mins to issue tickets to one person. i stayed in two queues just to find out one counter does not have a person to issue tickets and other one was closed with a chain. no one can figure this out till you reach the front when 300-400 people are pressing to each other. somehow you get it in to find out changing areas are worse than public toilets. most of the lockers are not usable. some rides were closed. cameras were shut down in water area rides. when i asked for pictures, they said cameras shut down when there is heavy crowd. excuse me, so you take pictures when there is no crowd or what? terribly managed. terrible service.

The one and only theme park in Sri Lanka. Love all the rides, dry and water. I wish they had a huge roller coaster ride as well, then it would look half complete compared with other theme parks in the world too.

Had a good time. Some activities in water park is not available in other amusement parks in Srilanka. It was a nice time for the kids. Food available in the their food court is not bad Customer services need to be improved. Though the prices are too much for the standard of activities when consider the maintenance and capital cost they spend it is acceptable.
Pathetic service from the crew down there. Customer service is literally nil except where the boat rides are available.   not worth the price we paid for .

Leisure World may not be in par with amusement parks round the world, but according to Sri Lankan standards it is very good. It has alot of potential and I hope some foreign company buys it over and changes everything. Entrance for both parks was 1750/- which I found to be a bit high, since three important rides were not operating. I also found it ridiculous that the log flume ride only worked at specific times. The water park too had many slides not working, which was a real bummer. Overall we did have a good time. Food and drinks were also sold at reasonable prices inside the park.

Not recommending for Muslims at all. The employees are very prejudice towards Muslims and do not have any manners what so ever. Employees went on lunch break for one hour and a half while the customers had to wait for the rides to be open after lunch. Disgusting bathrooms.

Actually the place is good. There are so many stuff you can do. I thought this place is for kids but it turned out to be more of a grown-ups Park. But anyways there are some points to keep in mind if you are planning to go here I got this all inclusive package which was priced for 2500/= hoping that it will be cool to do EVERYTHING.but there were few lame stuff. So do not go for the full package. Get a normal package and get the tickets separately. It's better if you can avoid going here on a Sunday. It's jam packed. Do not miss the pool area and don't forget your swimwear. The log flume, wave pool and the maverick-12 has time schedules. So try not to miss those. Anyways, like I said the place is good  for both young and old.
really funny day it was amazing thanks leisure world,water park is amazing we all are really happy that day
IT was an amazing....... thank you to give like this entertainment.we really enjoyed in swimming park i loved it....

I found some time to visit "Leisure world water parks Sri Lanka" in this month while I was on  my vacation with my family. It is the worst ever experience for a sri Lankan to receive such a bad experience from the start. Firstly people who were at the entrance had no intention of providing service except to push me to buy tickets for a heart patient who is 70 years old and her care taker even I tried describing the same. Then at the tickets counter couple of guys who were really busy with fixing some sound clip of their own was not willing to listen to my request nor neither wanted to call his superior, reason given phone lines were out. I sincerely offered my mobile for them to make a call, which they didn't have time to do so. Finally I paid LKR 7,700.00 for 7 people including my kids, but only 3 managed to use partially working rides. It was so pathetic to witness the insider officials poor attention towards the guests.  And adding more agony to our enjoyment, most of the people on duty didn't have idea on certain rides (i.e. we were told Lazy pool is for us to walk, as per my experience in else where this was not the case). Finally as a customer's right, when I ask the name of the person at the ticketing counter I was answered with arrogant way which was well supported by the rest of the crew including security personal (But I heard his name). Me being Sri Lankan I would love to see these sort of projects building in sri Lanka, But very sorry to say the disappointment which I gained will never spread the good mouth on your worst arrangement ever for a leisure seeker.
Meals were very reasonable and clean. Staff were very kind and co operative. Excellent work. Keep it up
It was amazing ... I loved it ! And we enjoyed it a lot . Hoping to visit soon ... Good luck leisure world team !
It was indeed a superb place for an outing and enjoy ourselves with friends breaking away from the monotonous day to day work.
Good place for one day outing. Not too far away from colombo. suitable for families and freids to enjoy their day.
It was a very exciting and fun place since they have activities for the whole family. Kids , teenagers , middle aged and nice views for the older people also.

Excellent to have fun with family or friends. Lots of fun activities to enjoy. Full package z what you should take to enjoy all. But i hate when they tell some rides are out of order when we reach there. That should be mentioned in web and updated

This is the best one comparing to others in Sri Lanka. But you must be unique and undated. because same machines and entertainment over time is not going to be a success. You need to be innovative and do things others have not done in a place like that. You need to add new events, machines and technology. Today's world we have holograms augmented reality and virtual reality. If you can apply those technologies it would be awesome!

The place is a bit disorganised. Specially with ride payments. Best is to pay for all at the front gate. Cuz nobody knows anything inside. Rides were good and thrilling. But safty precautions were not enough in my opinion. Water park was great. But the have specific time for wave pool and other rides. So we have to do stuff at there times not ours. But overall a good spend the day with family.

Compared to the other world class theme park customer service is very poor.none of your staff members are so coperate to the customer.they act like we are enamies.may be they do not have a proper motivational level to work.so lethagic. but very few are doing good. this will improve if the management can provide good solutions to improve their motivational level and the intrest of working.
Visited with family n kids.nice n clean kids pool.awesome rides for the adults.would be nice if better food options were available
Had a great time with my friends. Super thrilling.. good service and friendly coordination from the staff. SATISFIED!!! :) :) :)

Can someone please explain to me about a theme park that doesn't have a generator and informs the visors that the rides are unavailable due to a power cut...  And rides closed because the people incharge is at lunch. Please next time advice all of this when buying the entrance ticket. Can we have a refund please???

Took our office to Leisure world! and they had a really good time. They were kind enough to give us a good package. The lunch was lovely and the rides are pretty decent. If you don't like crowds you should go on a weekday! Their changing rooms need to be done up a bit better as should their washrooms in the ladies. If you are a first timer always inform the attendants at the rides. Go there in the morning to make full use of all rides.
we enjoyed the day at leisure world. but it is useless to go on a rainy day. time must be sheduled earlier for required areas. water area was really interesting

Went with my family and had good fun. The kids (3 boys) had a nice time. While some staff are very helpful ...other are pretty rude. Specially the ladies handling the lockers need some training on customer service.
It was so great, and wonderful. Thank you so much. We are looking forward to coming again having a great time there.

1)Buy Package B only (Rs1100) Package A or others are good if you are a complete stranger for theme parks. 2)Take tubes and all inflatables as there is a huge selfish battle for taking those into their own possession for hours . 3)Refrain from Red slide named thunder cruise or crazy cruise (ridiculous names!) since it will give a nice reddish back with scratches on your skin 4)Wear only Nylon swimming attires Cheers! Have fun
